you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave is episode 1366 a
and today's date is August 29th 2017 and
the thought of the episode is the ugly
truth of the economic disaster that's
headed our way let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now we
are watching the global economy
deteriorate very very quickly and we're
getting more and more indicators that
are showing that this is definitely
happening now we've been following many
many different indicators and some of
them are already showing us in a
recession some are saying that we're
entering into a depression and we've
been watching retail well that has been
imploding like there's no tomorrow we
also see out in the eurozone out in the
UK that things are not going well right
now consumer spending growth in the
eurozone well it's likely to slow this
year even though they're saying there is
improvements of consumer confidence
where people are saying that things feel
better but what's really happening right
now is that households real income
growth well it has slowed and they're
seeing higher inflation and the wages
are declining and when you put these
things together what happens people
don't spend their money and this is
exactly what we're seeing right now now
remember the central bank's they want
people to spend they want people to go
into their pockets go into their savings
account and they want them to go spend
this money they also want you to go into
your home equity take that money out
borrow it and go spend in the economy
because their biggest problem is is
getting people to spend their money they
can't get people to do this and this is
a huge huge problem now what's very
interesting is that Best Buy came out
and said that they had strong sales and
we need to remember something that many
people aren't realizing that there are
many different stores that are closing
right now I mean one of them is HH Greg
that went bankrupt and what they're
saying is that this is really not normal
because what is happening is their
competitors are closing down
which means people are then going over
to Best Buy to make a purchase and what
we're seeing right now is moving forward
that these strong sales that they're
seeing right now well it's not going to
be the new normal because once again as
these companies go out of business as
more people lose their job that traffic
is also going to dry up because we're
seeing it happen all over the place we
see that many many people are not
purchasing homes right now now if we
take a quick look at the US housing
we're seeing that it's slowing wages are
only growing by two point five percent
houses are increasing their prices are
growing by five percent and what is
happening here is that people can't keep
up with the inflation in the housing
market because their income is not
keeping up with inflation now if we look
at the data we can see that there are
different cities that are easier to
purchase a house and there are different
cities that it's much more difficult and
when we look at this we can see the
difference here now when we're looking
at this chart that I have on the x-22
report here on youtube you can see the
chart if we look at Seattle for instance
well this chart shows how much household
income increase is needed to buy the
median priced home in the u.s. cities so
if we look at Seattle we're looking at a
number of about 14% or so very close to
14% if we look at Portland we are
looking at 8% if we look at Dallas we're
looking at 8% Las Vegas we're looking at
8% Miami we're looking at four and a
half percent so what we're seeing is
that these individuals well they're
gonna need a lot more money their wages
are gonna have to go up to purchase a
home in these areas and there's all
these different cities that are listed
and it's becoming very very difficult
for people to basically afford a home
today this is why we see the housing
market well it's in trouble it's not
doing well we see that foreign buyers
they are pulling back especially from
China and we can see that the everyday
American they're not purchasing homes
and in many different cities and I'm not
talking about the case-shiller 20 cities
where they're able to pump that up maybe
they can't do it in every single city in
the United States but if you go outside
of this area you know and you can see if
you go into Zillow if you go on to
realtor.com or any of these sites you
can see that people have been trying to
sell their homes and they just can't
move them and prices are coming down
traffic is drying up we saw this back in
2007 and the following might explain why
this is happening now according to the
data from the US Labor Department the
percentage of Americans in their prime
work years between the ages of 25 and 54
who actually have jobs well they're
still way below the level the level
prior to the 2008 Great Recession wage
growth has been stagnant on top of that
debt levels are hitting record highs
student debt consumer debt auto loan
debt and the rest they're hitting record
highs people are once again unable to
pay their debts over the last 12 months
for example Capital One's net
charge-offs
increased by 40 percent cash levels are
also incredibly low and we can see that
many Americans they just don't have
enough money now let's see how much
money people actually have according to
Bank of America's annual report from
2016 it shows that the bank has 592
billion in consumer deposits from 46
million households that works out to be
an average of about twelve thousand
eight hundred and seventy now that's not
per person that's per household now this
includes everything savings investment
and retirement now if we go back 20
years ago and we look at Bank of
America's annual report it showed that
the bank had 392 billion in deposits
from 30 million households that works
out to be 13 thousand 67 per household
so today people
are saving or they have less than they
had in 1997 and this is 20 years later
and if you tack on inflation on top of
this which means the dollar value is
decreased because you need more dollars
to pay for that product or that service
they don't have or we don't have that
much money this is the problem and
remember this includes investments which
a lot of people can't touch right down
retirement which a lot of people might
not be able to touch right now and the
savings so you know the savings part of
it is much much less now Bank of America
is out there and they're saying that
this could get ugly really really fast
now what they did is that the Bank of
America credit team they did something
so few finance professionals bother to
do these days they looked at fundamental
data to reach a conclusion that is
independent of how much the Apple stock
from the S and B will have to buy to
send the Dow Jones green specifically
the bank looked at liquidity situation
in the bond market and found that while
for the time being there is little to
worry about once the central bank's put
melts away that's when the real test
will take place and according to Bank of
America they're saying that this could
get ugly
pretty darn fast and what's very
interesting about what's happening in
the stock market what's happening in the
real economy that we see these patterns
repeat over and over and over again now
we don't have the crashes at the same
exact time sometimes they're able to
manipulate the entire economy for a
longer period of time because they learn
from their mistakes and they keep adding
to them to make sure that they can
manipulate every part of the market and
this is what we're seeing right now but
what's very interesting is that
according to the last the latest
conference board survey 80% of Americans
surveyed believe that stock prices will
not be lower in the next 12 months now
the last time the nation was so
convinced of the markets permanently
high plateau
was in the fall of 2007 and guess what
happened
everything fell apart and this is what's
going to happen again we they've created
this illusion that everything is great
that many speculators they are long the
Dow futures they believe that this will
never end and they did this back in 1929
and they did this back in 2008 and there
were many many people that lost out on
this and this is what we're going to see
this time because you know that this all
can't be sustained the economy is
breaking down retail is a disaster
housing is a disaster it is imploding on
itself the GDP numbers are faked and
manipulated the unemployment numbers are
faked and manipulated the stock market
is completely manipulated we have
central banks around the world buying
all the different stocks to keep
everything propped up and they don't
have to buy that many I mean the fangs
all they have to do is buy a couple of
them and it looks like everything is
doing really well and this is what
they've been doing but as we can see
that eventually what is going to happen
people are going to be scratching their
head saying ok these companies are not
bringing in revenue they're not bringing
in sales they have no more plants to
close they can't lay off that many more
people right now or the company cannot
operate they can't buy back their shares
because they don't have enough funds so
their earnings are now dropping the
revenue is now dropping the sales are
now dropping do we really believe what
this market is doing right now and we
are entering this territory and we can
see that many of the corporations I mean
how could they be doing well if more and
more retail stores are closing remember
online sales are only about 8 to 10
percent of the brick-and-mortar retail
business because this is a
trillion-dollar business when they tell
you that Oh Amazon just made 10 billion
dollars for their at the unit you know
there are online sales it's it's nothing
compared to the brick-and-mortar
business of retail and we could see
right now we're coming into the holiday
months once again last holiday it was a
disaster that's why all these stores are
closing what do you think is going to
happen this time around because they
depend on the holiday to push them
through the whole part of next year if
they do not do it if they don't get the
sales you're going to see forget 8,000
stores you're gonna see like 17 20
thousand stores closed and it's going to
be a complete disaster this is where
we're headed right now do you really
think all of a sudden it's going to
improve no it's impossible think about
all those people they're gonna be losing
their jobs
in the retail market they can't find
jobs once again in the retail market
because a lot of stores are closing
there's just not that many job openings
a lot of people lost their jobs in
high-paying positions and they're
working to three part-time jobs so the
automobile industries in trouble the
retail industries in trouble we have a
lot of manipulated and fake numbers this
is going to be a disaster this is the
ugly truth of the economy of what it's
really doing right now and yes this is a
slow grind to a major disaster I mean
all we're waiting for is some type of an
event the stock market to come down
maybe 25% then all hell breaks loose
that's all it will take where companies
have the excuse to say we got to lay off
close these plans sell these buildings
do whatever we have to do and it'll be
all over the corporate media and the
whole thing will be a complete disaster
this is what's going to happen because
we know as we move forward the situation
is just going to get worse and worse and
worse we've been tracking this for quite
a while and we can see that it there's
been no real improvement yes there's
been improvement in the manipulated
numbers but there's been no improvement
in the hard real data it's not like oh
look RadioShack just opened a thousand
stores Best Buy's expanding Macy says
Wow sales are so great we're gonna open
10 more stores this is not happening the
opposite is happening and everything is
contracting and it's still contracting
and it's just going to get worse this is
why you need to get ready and prepared
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
